trans:
Discover what it is like to participate in the daily operation of a communication service.
You will have the opportunity to develop your own project from A to Z into a finished product / event.
You can start hands-on yourself with a varied range of tasks.
You get the freedom to create ideas yourself and to complete your projects / assignments within the set deadlines.
Learn about the strategy and context within which the practice of our communication service is situated.
Internship activities
The main assignment will be to organize events for prospective students together with the communication team. In addition, you will be involved in the management of internal and external communication to prospective students and other target groups. Some examples:
Organization of events: you help with the organization of events for prospective students and staff (eg online information day, further study grant, Faculty Master Info Sessions, Faculty Research Day, Faculty Info Day);
Shaping all kinds of print communication (posters, brochures, leaflets ...). This can range from designing in existing templates to starting a completely new folder;
Updating social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, etc.) and the website with fresh or original content, including photos, videos, text, and PowerPoint presentations.
Participation in and input at meetings of the Communications Service;
